abstract: Israeli Foreign Min Avigdor Lieberman resigns his post, saying Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition government is 'opportunist' rather than 'nationalist'; move puts Netanyahu in difficult position, having only two days left to announce new coalition government or hand chance to form new government to his political rival.
lead_paragraph: Avigdor Lieberman’s decision is unlikely to block a coalition by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, but it would leave him with a razor-thin majority in Parliament.

headline.main: Israeli Foreign Minister Says He Won’t Join Netanyahu’s New Government
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Ally Declines to Join Government, Putting Premier in Bind

snippet: Avigdor Lieberman’s decision is unlikely to block a coalition by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, but it would leave him with a razor-thin majority in Parliament.
